fields.Chapter Title: Eternal Life, Eternal Love: Gender and the perfected female in the contemporary resurrection allegory of Breaking Dawn
fields.Book Title: Gender(ed) Identities: Critical Rereadings of Gender in Children's and Young Adult Literature
fields.Author/Editor of Larger Work: Tricia Clasen and Holly J. Hassel
fields.Description/Abstract: The fourth book in Stephanie Meyer's popular Twilight series, Breaking Dawn, is a resurrection story that bridges contemporary human relationships and conventional religious principles. This chapter examines how the lead character, Bella, personifies the ideal Mormon female. The ongoing discussion of how the books might influence girls and young women is reviewed, before comparing the story lines of Breaking Dawn with LDS doctrine. Social implications for young women are then discussed.
